byline.original: By WILLIAM YARDLEY and ERIK OLSEN

abstract: Striking blend of old and new in Point Hope, Alaska, and the relative ease with which its residents navigate changes, are being tested by the strongest push yet to drill for oil offshore; some residents feel that the village is being torn apart by the fight between development and the preservation of an existing lifestyle.
snippet: The residents of Point Hope, Alaska, have long fought outside forces trying to change the nature of the town; now the fighting is from within.
lead_paragraph: The residents of Point Hope, Alaska, have long fought outside forces trying to change the nature of the town; now the fighting is from within.

headline.main: Arctic Village Is Torn by Plan for Oil Drilling
headline.print_headline: Arctic Village Is Torn by Plan For Oil Drilling
headline.seo: Point Hope, Alaska, Is Split by Oil-Drilling Plan
